intro: Lepyrodiclis holosteoides var. stellarioides, commonly known as the star-like daisy, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies, sunflowers, and other composite flowers. The plant is characterized by its small, clustered yellow flowers surrounded by pale green bracts that resemble leaves. It typically grows in moist, open habitats such as grasslands and stream banks. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and horticultural study.
